Every paragraph in this column would have been laughably unbelievable 18 months ago. Putin interfering in the U.S. election? President Trump? A pro-Russian administration? But when this slowly unfolded, day by day, and inch by inch, we gradually became de-sensitized to the change that Trump has brought to America: campaigning on lies, turning America’s foreign policy on its head, and making the United States a subordinate ally to Russia."""" And yes, it's terrifying. We have reason to fear that Trump will hand over sensitive intelligence to Putin; green-light further Russian aggression against Ukraine and the Baltic states; connive at the destruction of the EU; help orchestrate electoral victories by Marine Le Pen and other extreme-right figures; undermine international institutions vital to democracy, human rights, anti-corruption, and the environment; support Assad as he continues his crimes against humanity; exacerbate the refugee crisis in order to destabilize Europe; strengthen a transnational authoritarian network that includes Duterte and Erdogan; accelerate fossil fuel extraction; sabotage alternative energy; and pursue any number of other destructive and destabilizing policies we can barely imagine.'
